actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Molinaro asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, March 15, 2024, it adjourn to meet on Tuesday, March 19, 2024, at noon for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Molinaro asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Wednesday, March 13, 2024, it adjourn to meet at 11:00 a.m. on Friday, March 15, 2024. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. S. 1278 — "To designate the Federal building located at 985 Michigan Avenue in Detroit, Michigan, as the "Rosa Parks Federal Building", and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 352

actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7521.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7521 — "To protect the national security of the United States from the threat posed by foreign adversary controlled applications, such as TikTok and any successor application or service and any other application or service developed or provided by ByteDance Ltd. or an entity under the control of ByteDance Ltd."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Stauber to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
